column4: hey guys, I've just updated my vaio laptop to jaunty hoping it might finally solve my 3d graphics problem. Pretty much everytime I try to run an openGL app, it crashes or gives me errors. I've tried googling the issue, and have browsed through the wiki, but nothing ive tried seems to fix it. Any ideas?
You had the same problems in 8.10 ?
so no ideas about openGL for the gma 900?
Do you get the same problem running from the jaunty LiveCD?
Nice idea, not a possibility for me. Broken optical drive :(
Do you have a flash drive?
I could try it, I'm not very privy to this ubuntu stuff - perhaps I should just try to manually install some drivers?

If you are getting the same problem between 8.10 and 9.04 I think it's likely a configuration issue, the intel driver changed a lot from 8.10 to 9.04, so I would expect you to at least have different bugs :)
A liveCD is a good baseline, if it works we can look at what's different between the LiveCD and your current system, if it doesn't we know it's just a bad driver and can try other things
Cool, I intend to try it when I have a chance to make a usb boot key. In the meantime, is there some sudo-apt get magically reinstall graphics drivers command?
No, you can try "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" which resets your /etc/X11/xorg.conf, but if you haven't changed it manually then it will likely be default already
Can you pastebin the output of "dmesg" and /var/log/Xorg.0.log, preferably right after a freeze?
sure. Do I want to use the framebuffer kernel interface? :P
Keep the default ( I should have told you "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh" which just keeps the defaults and doesn't prompt at all, sorry )
Yes, ( do NOT paste it directly to the channel, use pastebin )
